DataElement.preferredName: CARS 4 How Afraid That Breast Cancer May Recur Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how afraid they are that their breast cancer may recur, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concerns About Recurrence Scale How Afraid That Breast Cancer May Recur Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A scale designed to systematically assess the extent and nature of a woman's fears about the possibility of breast cancer recurrence._A question about how afraid an individual is that their breast cancer may recur._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Fear Likert Scale Score 6 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 5 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

Concepts.definition: A response of 5 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 4 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

Concepts.definition: A response of 4 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 3 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

Concepts.definition: A response of 3 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 2 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

Concepts.definition: A response of 2 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response of 1 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

Concepts.definition: A response of 1 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: I Very afraid.

Concepts.definition: A response of 6 on a scale for the subjective scoring of fear that ranges from 1: Not at all afraid to 6: Very afraid.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How afraid are you that your
ReferenceDocuments.description: How afraid are you that your breast cancer may recur?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.

DataElement.origin: CARS: Concerns About Recurrence Scale, Suzanne M. Johnson Vickberg, Ph.D., Ann Behav Med 2003
